result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy M. Leggett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 9/15/16 Motion Hearing
and Order to seal Exhibits
Restitution Information

2:13 p.m. Defendant Timothy M. Leggett in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Pfeifer recites agreement-Koppelman concurs. Exhibits 1, 2 and 3 marked (medical records) - received. Pfeifer statement to strict proof in Alford plea. State moves to dismiss Count 3 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Victim Impact Statement filed. Restitution information filed. Based on Complaint and Exhibits Court finds strong proof of disorderly conduct and battery. Defendant enters guilty plea with declaration of innocence - Alford plea. Koppelman statement to reasons for Alford plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and accepts Alford plea. Pfeifer/Koppelman/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court sentence
WHS/POP - 1 year
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
Restitution - $774.40, includes 10% surcharge
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 2:43 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for December 19, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
from Attorney Koppelman
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 13, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Jury Trial cancelled per ADA and Atty Koppelman's office. Scheduled for plea and sentencing 10/13/2016 @ 2:00 p.m.

2:14 p.m. Defendant Timothy M. Leggett in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Koppelman - statement to medical records and witness list - Court will allow supplemental witness list to be filed - if State objects - hearing will be held. Motions 1 - 4 of State's Motion in Limine - statutes will be enforced. #5 - will preclude testimony to no prior convictions; testimony regarding prior conduct will be allowed as an admissible character trait. #6 - Court will enforce statutory rule of evidence-will preclude defense from violating rule. #7 - 10 - Pfeifer statement to standard paragraphs - does not believe they will apply - Koppelman agrees. #11 - Court will enforce rule of evidence. #12 - Denied. #13 - Koppelman provides offer of proof - Pfeifer/Koppleman/Court discussion - evidence is relevant and there can be testimony re what substances defendant ingested at relevant time periods, what substances were administered to him, manner hin which he behaved - jury instruction will be determined at later date. Defense can present evidence - Court will determine whether evidence is sufficient to provide jury instruction. Pfeifer statement to timeline. #14 - Granted. #15 - Granted. #16 - Granted. No witness will be allowed to directly testify to defendant's intent. Bail continued. Adj. 2:57 p.m.
in Limine-State's

2:33 p.m. Defendant Timothy M. Leggett in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sowinski statement to offer - Koppelman -- rejected offer at the time - requested additional information from DA - has not yet received. Sowinski requests trial date. Counsel to meet in chambers at 8:15 a.m. prior to trial. Any motions must be filed with proper notice pursuant to statutes. Bail continued. Adj. 2:44 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 14, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

2:56 p.m. Defendant Timothy M. Leggett in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig - statement to need for medical expert input prior to resolution. Koppelman agreement to medical expert input. Bail continued. Adj. 2:58 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
State's Reply to Discovery continued
Pre-trial conference at 02-23-2016 02:30 pm

9:10 a.m. Defendant Timothy M. Leggett in court with attorney James Charles Koppelman. Steven Mitchell Michlig, Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig statement--State files Amended Complaint with misdemeanor charges only. Court accepts Amended Complaint. Koppelman in receipt of Amended Complaint; waives reading; pleads not guilty to all counts. Koppelman speaks to bond modification--lift no drink. Michlig statement. Court speaks to bond condititions--denies bond modification. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

Koppelman in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.

2:37 p.m. Defendant Timothy M. Leggett in court with attorney James C. Koppelman.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
Bail continued. Adj. 2:39 p.m.
No intoxicants, no taverns.  No contact WHATSOEVER with Sherri Moore.
